meanings.definition: A very small amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: I only need a smidgen of sugar for my tea.
meanings.sent2: She added a smidgen of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: I asked for a smidgen of ice cream, but they gave me a whole bowl!
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like a smidgen of light in the darkness of the world.
meanings.sent5: The smidgen of hope in her heart kept her going through tough times.

meanings.sent1: There's not even a smidgen of dust on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: He found a smidgen of paint left in the can.
meanings.sent3: The detective discovered a smidgen of evidence that cracked the case wide open.
meanings.sent4: Her smile revealed a smidgen of mischief in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The old map had a smidgen of treasure marked in the corner.
